sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The sin function is used to find the sine of an angle given in radians. For example, sin (0) is 0.
sections.text_content: The sin function is used to find the sine of an angle given in radians. For example, sin (0) is 0.
sections.mdown_content: The **sin** function is used to find the sine of an angle given in radians. For example, **sin** (0) is 0.

sections.title: Example
code:
const pi := 3.14159
        for i : 1 .. 12
            const angle := i * pi / 6
            put "Sin of ", angle, " is ", sin ( angle )
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the sine of p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the sine of p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the sine of pppp/6 radians.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the cos and tan functions for calculating cosine and tangent.

the sind function which finds the sine of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the cos and tan functions for calculating cosine and tangent.
the sind function which finds the sine of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[cos.html](cos)** and **[tan.html](tan)** functions for calculating cosine and tangent.
the **[sind.html](sind)** function which finds the sine of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
